item.name: 7 Wonders: Cities

item.name: 7 Wonders: Leaders
item.comment: essen 2013 math trade. It seems that the leaders gives each player guidelines to build its empire, this could be a good thing because you dont have to burn your mind and decide what to do its turn.

item.name: 7 Wonders: Manneken Pis
item.conditiontext: i bought the 7 wonders pack, so i have it double now.

item.name: The Adventurers: The Temple of Chac
item.comment: A family and a very fun game. Its more deadly than the pyramid of horus but plays more quicker.

item.name: Age of Conan: The Strategy Board Game
item.comment: Excellent boardgame, an amazing empire building experience! I love it...

item.name: Ascending Empires
item.comment: played it twice, we liked it but the $$%^&**%@ board made me sold it...

item.name: Augustus
item.conditiontext: Like new, only Greek rules are included but I can print other online rulebooks per demand.

item.name: Autokrator
item.comment: Essen 2012

item.name: Axis & Allies

Box shows self wear, missing components:
UK fighter : 1 Germany uboat: 1

item.name: Axis & Allies: Pacific
item.comment: Interesting starting option, i liked the fact that is pacific oriented...
item.conditiontext:
Box shows self wear, missing
UK artillery:1 Japan aircraft:1 grey discs:3
These items arent effecting the gaming experience and can be replaced quite easily.
item.wantpartslist: UK artillery:1 Japan aircraft:1 grey discs:3

item.name: B-17: Queen of the Skies
item.comment: Love it, i played it over and over and cant have enough of it. My 9 year old son roll the dice for the German aircraft, my 1st bomber (aka Spearmen/4 mission exp.) got hit in the bombs bay and the bombs explode killing everybody on board. My 2nd bomber (aka Gladiator/7 mision exp.) got hit on the port wing by a hell diving FW 190 and the fuel tank got fire, even with my rabbitfoot the hit was the same, everybody bail out over Belgium but they end up as P.O.W. My son's smile was everlasting. I love this game absolutely. Bought it on E-bay from England. Best solo game ever, Its a good thing to watch Memphis Belle also.

item.name: B-29 Superfortress
item.comment:
Great game and a great addition for the B17 owners. Recommended absolutely. (after a couple of plays its boring...)
EDIT: trade it for Space Empires 4x, from Latvia.

item.name: Backgammon
item.comment: Classic greek public game for all ages

item.name: Bamboleo
item.comment: Great family and party game. Harder than Jenga extreme.

item.name: Battle Line
item.comment:
A nice card game, should work with the females. Not actually a wargame, more a simple card game.
Τίποτα το ιδιαιτερο, ενα καλο καρτοπαιχνιδο που θα αρεσει στο γυναικειο φύλλο. Το θετικο ειναι το μικρο του μεγεθος οποτε και κουβαλιεται - στηνεται ευκολα και εχει και μικρη διαρκεια.
EDIT: its an amazing game to play under the Greek sun in the summer vacations and the Greek beaches.

item.name: Battlefields of Olympus
item.comment: Great artwork, boring battle mechanism, the attacker is in disadvantage.

item.name: Battleground: Crossbows & Catapults War Chest Starter Set
item.comment: Kids love it
item.conditiontext: box corners are ripped and taped, from a smoke free/pet house

item.name: BattleLore (Second Edition)
item.comment: A pleasant game, more lighter than CC:A, but it is negative for the production value that it has 1 die less and some victory point tokens (2-5v.p. at least) in case of a tie for example 18-18 points... initial rating 8.5 (March 2014) -------------------------------------------------------- Havent played the lore cards yet because my plays are with my 12 year old son but having over 200 plays with CCA makes my mind difficult to synchronize with these victory conditions (capturing the flags instead of eliminating the enemy units) and i m loosing badly.. so from this point of view i m beginning to dislike it.. rating 7.0 (June 2014) --------------------------------------------------

item.name: Battleship
item.comment: My favorite high school time playing

item.name: Battleship Galaxies: The Saturn Offensive Game Set
item.comment: Fantastic miniatures, a good tactical and dice game. definitely a serious battleship upgrade!

item.name: Battlestar Galactica
item.comment: Co op with a hidden traitor, excellent themed, a great fun to play but needs 5-6 players at least..

item.name: Beowulf: Das Spiel zum Film
item.comment: Great game, like the theme too! More challeging than KINGDOMS.

item.name: Blackbeard
item.comment: Excellent boardgaming 'narrative' experience.

item.name: Carcassonne: Die Burg
item.comment: 2 player game, short time, limited space on table do i need to say more?
item.conditiontext: very good, english rules printed.

item.comment: Great family co op game.

item.name: Castle Panic: The Wizard's Tower
item.comment: A great expansion that takes castle panic to a higher level! The playing time has increased but it is well worth it! ------------------------- suited for adult players mostly..

item.name: Cave Troll
item.comment: An excellent - fast - light strategy and tactics 2-4 player game. If you play it with only 2 players use half the board. Ah! i almost forgot, amazing miniatures!

item.name: Chess
item.comment: The grandpa of strategy games

item.name: Combat Commander: Europe
item.comment: played it twice, it was nice and the rules have the usual learning curve but my regular opponent likes other games, so i traded it away..

item.name: Commands & Colors: Ancients
item.comment: It reminds me the excellent PC game Tin Soldiers: Alexander & Julius Caesar. First play solo, very dynamic, i loved its simplicity. Its a fantastic board game experience.
item.wantpartslist: C3i Scenario inserts for the base game and the expansions. an order 3 center card valley games set of dices

item.name: Commands & Colors: Ancients Expansion Pack #1 – Greece & Eastern Kingdoms
item.comment: a must buy expansion for the basic game.

item.name: Commands & Colors: Ancients Expansion Pack #2 – Rome and the Barbarians
Commands & Colors: Ancients Expansion Pack #3 – The Roman Civil Wars
Commands & Colors: Ancients Expansion Pack #4 – Imperial Rome
Commands & Colors: Ancients Expansion Pack #5 – Epic Ancients II
item.comment: For the veteran players of the CC:A series the EPIC game experience is the ultimate goal! I just cant have enough, the only difference is the time factor, it takes about 2 and a half hours to play a scenario.
item.conditiontext: C3i Scenario inserts No 25 & 26

item.name: Commands & Colors: Ancients Expansion Pack #6 – The Spartan Army
item.comment: This is an amazing expansion, the scenarios are absoloutely marvellous and full of intrigue! The additional blocks are most welcomed. I played yesterday the battle of Amphipolis and i believe is one of the best scenarios.

item.name: The Conquerors: Alexander the Great
item.comment: Rulebook is terrible and needs many additions, the game's mechanisms is similar to Hannibal: Rome vs Carthage and the card deck also and dont get me wrong, this is a good thing. It is very difficult for the Persian player to win but thats no problem for me, because i like the defensive war. It describes perfectly Alexander's history and i believe that is the best boardgame until now regarding that matter.

item.name: Conquest of Planet Earth: The Space Alien Game
item.comment:
fantastic solo and family boardgame story telling experience! Awesome production quality and artwork! -------------------------------------------------------

item.name: Crossbows and Catapults
item.comment: one of my favorite destruction game as a child

item.name: Dawn of the Zeds (Second edition)
item.comment: fantastic solo gameplay experience! it feels like watching a Romero movie! -------------------------- edit, after 12 games i finally won the classic nightmare scenario!!! what a relief.... what a great gaming experience is this! OMG!

item.name: Defenders of the Realm
item.comment: Amazing solo-family fantasy game. I dont care if it shares the same mechanisms as pandemic (never played that) it is a great combined boardgame. Every play is a new adventure, totaly love it.
item.conditiontext: has the artscow 54 card deck plus components for the 5 summer league scenarios.

item.name: Defenders of the Realm: The Barbarian

item.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition)
item.comment: Played it once...sold it...and bought it back! :)
item.conditiontext: no insert.
item.wishlistcomment:
Υπολοχαγοι που αξιζουν
Verminous Valyndra Merick (πιο πολυ για τις καρτες του) Queen Ariad is a BEAST of an agent. She's a tough kill, does some good damage, and has some great cards in her plot deck. She won't be as useful in the Nerekhall campaign
[u]No dependencies (generally good)[/u] Baron Zachareth Rylan Olliven Tristan Olliven
[u]Specific to monsters in general (not bad)[/u] Alric Farrow is specific to small and master monsters Valyndra is specific to large monsters Verminious is specific to low hp monsters Bol'Goreth is specific to poison/disease and other conditions
[u]Specific to monster types (bad imo)[/u] Splig is specific to wilderness monsters Eliza is specific to dark monsters Ariad is specific to cursed monsters Mirklace is specific to hot monsters
[u]Specific to overlord cards (bad imo)[/u] Belthir is specific to Basic I overlord cards Merick is specific to Magic overlord cards Queen Ariad is specific to Trap overlord cards (and wilderness monsters)
Overall I think the easiest to use are Baron Zachareth, Valyndra and Alric Farrow. ---------------------------- Get Valyndra and never look back! Amazing dragon sculpt? Check! Dragon as a lieutenant? Check! Strong/easy plot deck and monster to use as overlord in game? Check!
Don't get Splig/Eliza/Merick/Serena/Ariad/Queen Ariad (too specialized in certain types of monsters) Don't get Belthir if using Basic II (otherwise okay)//Belthir's plot deck directly affects cards in the Basic deck. Frenzy, Dash, Critical Blow, Dark Fortune, and a few others. Don't get Serena/Raythen (paying more for heroes, you don't need more heroes - plot decks look to fulfill only a very niche part of the game)
Alric Farrow, Zachareth, Bol'Goreth look okay. Don't know enough bout SoN Lieutenants. ------------------------------------------------- Here's a breakdown of which agents you CAN'T summon into the various campaigns/mini-campaigns, as of now:
Shadow Rune: Zachareth Labyrinth of Ruin: Ariad, Queen Ariad Lair of the Wyrm: Valyndra The Trollfens: Bol'Goreth
Any of these agents can be summoned into any of the other campaigns, just not their own. NO agents may be summoned for an Interlude or Finale.
Raythen and Serena are a little different — if their hero, ally or lieutenant versions are in play in a quest, then you can't summon their agent version into that quest. So if the hero party is using them in a campaign, their agents are right out for the duration, though you can still use the rest of their Plot deck.
As for other agents, it depends entirely on the quest you're playing. For example, if a quest you're playing (like "A Fat Goblin") lists Splig (the lieutenant) under the Monsters heading in one or both encounters, you can't summon him as an agent during that quest. But if you're using Splig's deck and playing a quest where Belthir is the lieutenant, then you CAN summon Splig. --------------------------------- ly what I was looking For, thanks. What do you mean about basic II? Who has the better plot deck between Alaric, Zach and Bol?
When you buy the base game, the Overlord gets a Basic deck which they can add and customize to, swapping out individual cards. When you buy Labyrinth of Ruin (the large expansion) the Overlord gets an entirely new deck (Basic II) ---------------------------------------- Zachareth. It's powerful and general.You cant use Zachareths agent in the base games "Shadow Rune" Campaign, -------------------------------------
My moneys on Alric Farrow, Valyndra or Bol'Goreth -------------------------------- Merick/Eliza/Serena are all really weak.
The rats are some of the nastiest monsters in the game. Love 'em. -------------------------------------------------------

item.name: Discworld: Ankh-Morpork
item.comment: a nice game with good quality components. You dont have a lot of strategic choices and i didnt like the victory condition objectives because they are very unbalanced. It could be played as a filler game though.

item.name: Dominion: Ο κυρίαρχος
item.conditiontext: Οι κάρτες έχουν φυσιολογική φθορά λόγω παιξίματος και καμία δεν είναι σχισμένη, τσαλακωμένη κτλ. ολα τα deck φυλασσονται σε ξεχωριστα ζιπ λοκ σακουλακια. πλαστική βάση καρτών δεν υπαρχει, το κουτι σε πολύ καλή κατάσταση με κλασικες απρες γωνιες φθορας ραφιου.

item.name: Dragon Slayer
item.comment: a nice filler-family game, i enjoy it and its fast.

item.name: Drako
item.comment: my kids love it!
item.conditiontext: The dragon figure is painted.

item.name: Duel of the Giants: Eastern Front
item.comment:
Very interesting game, you constantly have to guess your opponets moves. It uses the mechanics from the Wings of War for the Tiger movements very succesfully. Great game!
EDIT: traded it for Dominion:Seaside, from Ireland.

item.name: DungeonQuest (third edition)
item.conditiontext:
Title: DungeonQuest Third Edition Publisher: Fantasy Flight Games Language(s): English Condition: content very good, box is worn on the edges
Includes printed and laminated upgrade-kit content for the revised edition

item.name: Dungeons & Dragons Επιτραπεζιο Παιχνιδι Φαντασιας
item.originalname: Dungeons & Dragons: The Fantasy Adventure Board Game
item.comment: great componets, boring gameplay

item.name: Escape of the Dead Minigame
item.comment: a nice themed rolling dice solo game. After a couple of plays it becomes boring.

item.name: A Few Acres of Snow
item.comment: First solo play today and it feels good. Knowing Dominion helps a lot and the map is simple and very smooth. The few components are enough to do their job. Overall i cant wait to play it against my regular opponents! Bravo Martin!
item.conditiontext: missing the french, german rules and the player aids.
item.wantpartslist: french, german rules and the player aids.

item.name: Field Commander: Alexander
item.comment: This is an excellent solo game. You feel like Alexander III, tough choices, difficult decisions, fierce battles, great joy after an epic fight. The first scenario is to introduce you to the game mechanics, always play a linked campaign except if you want to practice before the real fight. I really enjoy it, i dont know about replaybility though, time will tell. ---------------------------------------------- FINAL UPDATE: trade it since i ve finished/won all scenarios. It feels like a pc game, since i finished it i dont want to play it anymore, same thing as [thing=28829][/thing]

item.name: Field Commander: Rommel
item.comment:
Just had my first game today in France, ghost dividion (30-11-2010) and i lost of course! Those allied force were keep coming and coming. Anyway i was excited for the desicions i had to make and i think that it is a prety solid game. I 'll play some more games before i 'll rate it. It took me around 3 to 4 hous because i had so many questions and i 've read the rules twice! Thanks BGG
(03-12-10) 2nd play, same op', lost again and it took me 3 hours. Very exciting game and the AI works pretty good. Its a very good solo strategy game because you have to make some very tough decisions.
EDIT: trade it for Glory to Rome, from Latvia ------------------------------------------------------------
bought again the deluxe edition... (28042015) :) FINALLY I WON! the ghost division scenario!!!! (after 5 plays) ------------------------------------------------------------
FINAL UPDATE: trade it since i ve finished/won all scenarios. It feels like a pc game, since i finished it i dont want to play it anymore, same thing as [thing=35350][/thing]

item.name: Fleet Commander: Nimitz
item.comment:
This game is a hidden gem! Sure it has its flaws and the rulebook is badly written (weird for a DVG game) but if you look the whole picture and consider that the designer managed to include an epic struggle in this box then you will realize that its a masterpiece!
Hint, use at least 3-4 extra (different colors) d10 and this will save you lot of time during battles...

item.name: Fresko
item.comment:
Just had my first play today, excellent family/worker placement/themed game, i really enjoy it with my sons. Beware, the purple color is aquired only by mix...
Αfter 2 plays in 2 days i had a nostalgia feeling regarding [thing=31483][/thing]. This is not a good sign for Fresco.

item.name: Friedrich
item.comment: Excellent wargame, easy and fast rules combined with deep tactician strategy, eht else could you ask for?

item.name: Galaxy Trucker
item.comment: superb game, just finished the first session with my 2 sons (9&11 years old). We had great fun, its a fantastic galactic experience, bravo Vlaada, the anniversary edition is a must buy for me now...

item.name: Galaxy Trucker: Rough Road Ahead
item.comment:
rated an 8 because it is an official free expansion!
20-08-2014 We played them for the first time, total catastrophy!!!

item.name: A Game of Thrones: The Board Game (Second Edition)
item.comment: Amazing updated artwork, excellent gameplay...kudos to the FFG!
item.wantpartslist: a westeros deck, any house cards

item.name: Germania: Drusus' Campaigns 12-9 BC
item.comment:
[microbadge=13314]
I just had my 1st play. Its a nice solo experience and quite relaxing i should say. The tables are doing a marvellous job and the dice rolling isnt too much for a solo game. I like its simplicity, the only negative that i find is the scale of the printed componets, they should be all together in a pdf file, because my map's boxe's (tribal relations, colonize status etc) are too small for my counters. (July 2011)

item.name: Guess Who?
item.comment: kids game in plenty variations.

item.name: Hannibal: Rome vs. Carthage
item.comment: After spending aprox. 5 hours in reading the rules and the BGG FAQ, i played, with my brother in law, a full game in 6 hours (2 days). Hannibal won due to provinces control. Its a masterpiece and the cards are an awesome mechanism. I love it. --------------------------- i m kinda sad that i ve traded my copy, i want Hannibal back home.. -------------------------------------------------------- UPDATE: after 2+ missing years, this masterpiece was added back to my collection! (July 2015)

item.name: Heroes of Normandie
item.comment: Great! exactly what i was looking for to play with my kids!

item.name: Heroica: Nathuz
item.comment: very good game for my sons

item.name: HeroQuest
item.comment: sold it to Athens, but i 've kept the board for the advanced heroquest edition missions.

item.name: HeroQuest Advanced Quest
item.comment: Η ελληνικη εκδοση υπηρξε το αγαπημενο παιχνιδι μου στα Λυκειακα χρόνια.

item.name: Hey! That's My Fish!
item.comment: a very good game for kids and family

item.name: The Hobbit: The Defeat of Smaug
item.comment: Α pleasant family semi coop game, i enjoy it and tells a good story too!

item.name: The Hunters: German U-Boats at War, 1939-43
item.comment: After 3.5 years of waiting das boot finally arrived at my home port! The solo game experience is as good as i have been waiting for, the legacy of the [thing=1032][/thing] continues but B17 is the undisputed King of the genre. Having said that, The Hunters is an excellent uboat boardgame out there and it will remain the best for many many years to come, my initial rating is 8.5 but it will go higher i believe.. ------------------------------------------------------ Game added at my collection: July 2015

item.name: Infection: Humanity's Last Gasp
item.comment: Fantastic solitaire gameplay experience. Excellent game!
item.conditiontext: It has the original artwork.

item.name: Jenga Xtreme
item.comment: a good game to play with kids and family

item.name: Jerusalem
item.comment: A fine euro / worker placement boardgame. Best played with 3/4.

item.name: Julius Caesar
item.comment: A fine game with many elements from the HotS and the other games from this line. I liked the fog of war feature and the battle system that you can find it also in the Space Empires 4x. trade it for CC:A exp 2

item.name: Justinian
item.comment: started a solo session, it seems interesting..

item.name: Kampf der Gladiatoren
item.comment: Great fun to play it with your kids! Very light strategy and tonnes of dices! Suitable for ages 8+

item.name: King of Tokyo
item.comment: A nice ameritrash game. Some cards texts issues (isnt very clear the purpose of them).

item.name: King of Tokyo Promo Cards
item.comment: 11 cards
item.conditiontext: 8/10 exoume

item.name: Kingdom Builder
item.comment: Excellent family euro game, fast, easy to learn and enjoyable!

item.name: Kingdom of Heaven: The Crusader States 1097-1291
item.comment: Ι have read the rules, its an interesting game about an era that i love to read in history books. I was dissapointed because in the rulebook there is no mention regarding the predecessors (AH's: [thing=234]Hannibal [/thing] and [thing=68][/thing]) because all rules regarding the army movements/battles/inteception/avoiding/naval movement etc were taken from there. There are many new rules though such us the shadowing, sieges, captive leaders, diplomacy, army attrition and more, that are very well implemented. The card driven system also reminds me [thing=12333][/thing] because of the cards that are removed if they are played as events, the shuffling of the deck etc. I must play this because its interesting and i m waiting for the 4th crusade expansion.

item.name: Kingdoms
item.comment: Αn excellent mathematic tile placement family game. Its great to play it with your kids! Instant success in my family! Ah and the plastic castles are so COOL!!!
item.conditiontext: English FFG edition, components are shorted in zip lock bags. From a smoke/pet free house.

item.name: Kingsburg
item.comment: Better than [thing=48726][/thing]..
item.conditiontext: TRADE INTEREST = LOW

item.name: Kingsburg: To Forge a Realm
item.comment: An outstanding expansion, gives more salt 'n' pepper to the base game, our family loves the events and the extra buildings, overall a great expansion for a great game! I cant rate it as a 10 due to its high cost though...

item.name: Labyrinth: The War on Terror, 2001 – ?
item.comment:
A heavy game, more difficult than Twilight Struggle. rated after 1st solo play. Approx. 5-7 hours session.
UPDATE I didnt had as much fan as in Twilight Struggle so i ve trade it.
item.conditiontext: a box cover corner is ripped C3i Nr 25 inserts included

item.name: Lancaster
item.comment: Excellent worker placement medieval game with great components. It made me get rid of Stone Age.. Fantastic to play it with kids too!

item.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game
item.comment: Its a nice solo card game but because its CGG i 'll skip it. I 'm tired of them as a MtG veteran. (initial rating 6 15 Oct 2012) ------------------------------------------ game left my collection and after 3 years returned through a trade, ok, i have changed my mind, i like it a lot as a solo experience, its like playing MtG solitaire and for this i enjoy it so much, if only there was something like that in the Star Wars universe... (rating 8.5 7 Aug 2015) --------------------------------------------------
item.conditiontext:

item.name: Lords of Waterdeep
item.comment: nice, quick, easy to explain and play, as for the cubes who says they are warriors/druids etc i see only cubes to collect and cash them at the appropiate quest/shopping cards, what theme? dungeon crawl? hahahahaha!

item.comment: One of the easiest 10's out there. An instant classic. Vlaada is one of the top game designers out there. Great theme, mechanisms, components and one of the best solo's i have played.

item.name: Magic: The Gathering
item.comment: I will always remember the days and nights (~1996-2000) that i played MtG with my best friend Kostas...great memories...once in my lifetime...
item.conditiontext: 3500 common cards with no basic lands. Greek guild Math trade 10/2015 plus 500 lands (100 each) = 12 kilos!!!

item.name: Magic: The Gathering – Arena of the Planeswalkers
Memoir '44
item.comment: I was a veteran player of Command and Colors:Ancients. When i played this game i was disappointed, it is very simple, with a small percentage of strategy compared to the other command and colors games. I know that this is the first of the series so its logical to be more simple in order to achieve higher sales. Overall it 's a good strategy game for new players in the strategic theme.
item.conditiontext: I removed the plastic tray because of the expansions to fit in the main box. I will keep the six plastic card trays because i need them for the CC:A plays.

item.name: Mutiny!
item.comment: a good game to play with your kids and family. It introduces them to the bidding mechanism

item.name: Mythotopia
item.comment: this looks great! played it with my 13 year old son and we liked it a lot! I m glad that I got rid the broken [thing=79828][/thing] because when I read that this was coming it was my only hope! Besides that I didn't liked the history frame also, so a fantasy one was more welcomed. The map artwork is extremely functional and the relaxing colors are awesome! the cards artwork is great too but it has the worst cover box artwork I have ever seen! As a 2 player game I don't think that it is that good but as a 3 or 4 it will shine!

item.name: Naval Battles
item.comment: fast, furious, cards, dices, custom fleet, 6 nations to choose from, small box to play at a cafe or at a pub, what else could you ask for?

item.name: Neuroshima Hex!
item.comment: Highly addictive..
item.conditiontext: will trade it as a package with Babel 13 / Steel Police / Duel

item.name: Nightfall: Martial Law
item.comment: Played this with 2 buddies who love it and have spent a lot of money for the basic game and its expansions. I didnt like it all because it reminds me a lot the 'King' Magic the Gathering and i d rather play that than nightfall or play 7 wonders if i want the draft mechanism or dominion if i wanna build my deck. It needs a dedicated group to play nightfall and i m not one of them, besides i have many other boardgames that are waiting to hit the table.

item.name: Ottoman Sunset
item.comment: Highly addictive, many things going on at the same time and the games escalates the activity onthe map witha superb way, i love the Twilight Struggle -import- deck mechanism too!

item.name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Rise of the Runelords – Base Set
item.comment: Excellent RPG in card format, i feel like playing [thing=699][/thing] but this one is better because i m not the bad guy anymore but one more hero among others! Great family game..
item.conditiontext: I have a second copy..

item.name: Patton's Best
item.comment: From Italy. I tried to play it 2 times but the rulebook was bad written and my enthusiasm flew away after a couple of hours. Trade it for Axis&Allies: Pacific

item.name: Peloponnesian War
item.comment: 2 years of hunt at ebay and i paid a descent amount of money to get it from the BGG market, hit the table twice (solo) but too complex for my taste, maybe if i had a veteran player to explain it but...trade it for CC:N
item.conditiontext: smoke free house. all componets are present. low trade interest, will only trade for highly rated or hard-to-find games.

item.name: Perplexus Epic
item.comment:
An excellent dexterity game. Needs tonnes of patience and carefully manouvering.
Εξαιρετικο παιχνιδι δεξιοτητας. Θελει πααααρα πολυ υπομονη και επιδεξιους χειρισμους.

item.name: Pocket Battles: Celts vs. Romans
item.comment: fast and light strategy-tactics game, you can play it every where.

item.name: Pocket Battles: Elves vs. Orcs
item.comment: essen 2013 math trade Great game, my sons (and i) love it! fun, quick, lot of strategy and all that in your pocket!

item.name: Pocket Battles: Macedonians vs. Persians
item.comment: another great addition to the family!

item.name: Puerto Rico
item.conditiontext: looking for the Greek edition only!

item.name: Race for the Galaxy
item.comment: A nice card game development with many strategies to win. Some card signs confused me and i needed to check the rules again and again.

item.name: RAF: The Battle of Britain 1940
item.comment: It is an awesome solo play experience. The depth in srategy, the crucial decisions you have to make, the unexpected events, the roll of the dices, everything is absolutely fantastic. So far is my ultimate solo playing experience in a "leader of the army level". B 17 is my other ultimate solo experience in a "rpg platoon level"
item.conditiontext: i dont really want to trade it but i ll do it for something good.

item.name: Rampage
item.comment: One of the most enjoyable family games i have ever played!
item.conditiontext: Cover box has 1 ripped side.

item.name: Revolver
item.comment: Good game and theme, also it comes with a great storage box for card games. (i 've put inside my glory to rome, pocket battles Romans vs Celts and Zombie in my pocket games). EDIT: not any more, trade it
item.conditiontext: from a smoke free/pet house

item.name: Risk
item.comment: All time favorite high school play. Teach us the area movement mechanism.

item.name: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island
item.comment: rated a 10 after first play, ok, this game is a masterpiece, top notch production values and the variable theme mechanism rocks! endless scenarios, definitely a keeper and a gem to my collection..

item.name: Roll Through the Ages: The Bronze Age
item.comment: Ι 've played it with my kids. We didnt liked it. We prefer the dice version of catan.

item.name: Rolling Bones
item.comment: fun game
item.conditiontext: English rulebook is damaged

item.name: Runebound (Δεύτερη Έκδοση)
item.comment: I just had my first session solo, i liked the game and it will be more exciting with 2 or 3 players.

item.name: Scooby Doo Στοιχειωμένο κάστρο
item.comment: kids game

item.name: Scotland Yard
item.comment: a very good game with family and kids. I prefer the old colorful map though...

item.name: Shadowrift
item.comment: First version, a pleasant (and decent) solo -2 handed- experience, very thematic as well. played it 3 times now (Drow - Demons - Necromancers) and won every scenario rather easily (I missed the hunting rule totally!!! so there is no chance that my victories are legal). It scales very well also and I love how different its time looks based on the scenario BUT I will wait until I play every scenario and couple of random ones to give my final verdict. Huge plus is the small box (the smallest I have ever seen for a card game of its size) which makes it easy to carry and play on vacation. Love the (1st version) artwork too! Initial rating 8.0 (December 2015). ---------------------------------------------------------------------

item.name: Sid Meier's Civilization: The Board Game
item.conditiontext: With Mao as the Chinese leader

item.name: Sid Meier's Civilization: The Board Game – Fame and Fortune
Die Siedler von Catan: Das Würfelspiel – XXL-Ausgabe
item.comment: Βασικα το πήρα για το φανταστικο ποτηρόζαρο.

item.name: Space Empires: 4X
item.comment: Fantastic 4X game, maybe its the best out there, i have played it solo only and i cant wait to play it with humans!
item.conditiontext:
not so much willing to trade this but i ll do it for a good game.
From a smoke/pet free house
item.wantpartslist: Ι need these chits: 3x ship wreck 2x black hole 2x mineral (10) 1x lost in space 1x nebula 1x super nova 1x danger

item.name: Space Hulk: Death Angel – The Card Game
item.comment:
a very nice game and well themed for a card game. One of the positive aspects is the small size of it, you can take it and play it everywhere, i usually play this on bed, perfect! I have 2 of the mini expansions, i would like more terrain cards though...
From a smoke/pet free house.

item.name: Spartacus: A Game of Blood & Treachery
item.comment:
Επιτελους, το απεκτησα χε χε!
A great fun adult game. Play it with your buddies and lots of beers!

item.name: Star Realms
item.comment: Essen 2014 Fast, furious, enjoyable, beautiful artwork, addictive!

item.name: Star Realms: Gambit Set
item.comment: solo and co-op cards rocks!

item.name: Star Wars: Galactic Battle Game
item.comment: Have 22 figures. Fun to play it with your kids.

item.name: Star Wars: The Card Game
item.comment: I like it! -------------------------------------------- ok, [thing=156776][/thing] was a killer for this one, my 13th year old son who is a SW fan told me to get rid of it, so i 've traded it away!
item.conditiontext: Played 2 times, box shows slightly wear.

item.name: Star Wars: X-Wing
item.comment: Ok, so i bought it second hand with 7 more miniatures. I had some plays and i really enjoy it, i dont like the lack of the 2 dices and thats why i rate it with a 6 (Dec 2014). ------------------------------------------------------- INITILAL RATING = 4 (Oct 2012) I am a star wars fan but Wings of War Deluxe set had 4 minis instead of 3 that this basic set comes with and needs 2 more battle dices. Too many expansions, to much money, same game, different theme. I owned WoW and trade it after a couple of games, i dont think that this one is better...i 'll pass.
item.conditiontext: Base set 30euro 1x X-Wing Wave #1 - 12 euro 1x Τie Fighter Wave #1 - 12 euro 1x Tie Interceptor Wave #2 - 12 euro 1x A-Wing Wave #2 - 12 euro 1x Tie Bomber Wave #3 - 12 euro 1x HWK-290 Wave #3 - 12 euro 1x B-Wing Wave #3 - 12 euro ---------------------------------------------- 1x E-Wing - 13 euro 1x Z-95 - 13 euro 1x Tie Phantom - 13 euro ------------------------------------------- Base set 24 euro 1x TIE Advanced Wave #1 - 8 euro - 1x Y-Wing Wave #1 - 8 euro

item.name: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – B-Wing Expansion Pack
item.comment: a must have for the rebel side.

item.name: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – E-Wing Expansion Pack
Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – HWK-290 Expansion Pack
Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – TIE Advanced Expansion Pack
item.comment: Darth Vader!

item.name: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – TIE Fighter Expansion Pack
item.comment: more options for the base game

item.name: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – TIE Interceptor Expansion Pack
Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – TIE Phantom Expansion Pack
Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – X-Wing Expansion Pack
item.comment: the more the better!

item.name: Steel Wolves: The German Submarine Campaign Against Allied Shipping – Vol 1
item.comment:
Aquired May 2011. Δεν μπορουσα να αντισταθω στον πειρασμό! To πιο ακριβο παιχνιδι της συλλογης μου. 130 ευρωπουλα μου στοιχισε! το ξεφορτωθηκα σε ανταλλαγη με το λοστ βαττλες, τέλεια και ευτυχως....
I dont think i 'm gonna play this in the next decade :(
item.conditiontext: from a smoke free/pet house. Low trade interest but if it is something i really want i 'll give it.

item.name: Stone Age
item.comment: an excellent worker placement boardgame that my kids love to play inspite of the 2 hours session.

item.name: Stratego Original
item.comment:
Αγαπημενο παιχνιδι των σχολικων μου χρόνων. Μετα το σκακι ήταν ότι καλλίτερο.
A great game to introduce the light strategy to your children. Its amazing how kids all over the world love this one!

item.name: Stronghold
item.comment: Absolutely marvellous game. I felt in love with it since the beginning. An excellent siege game that was missing from the market. Το απόλυτο έπος τώρα πια στο τραπέζι σας, ξαναζήστε όλες τις μεγάλες πολιορκίες και αφήστε την φαντασία σας να σας ταξιδέψει.

item.name: Stronghold: Heroes
item.comment: ψιλομουφα μου φανηκε αλλα το πηρα παρολα αυτα.

item.name: Subbuteo
item.comment: one of my favorites as a high school kid.

item.name: Thunderbolt Apache Leader
item.comment: Thank you DVG for producing such a great game, you saved me from my family/euro gaming duties, at last, i can enjoy a proper solo wargame at nights while my children are sleeping...

item.name: Ticket to Ride: Ευρώπη
item.comment: great family game

item.name: Tobago
item.comment: very interesting theme, my boys loved it! The island was full of treasures! the modular board rocks! the game pieces are awesome! great game and very unique!

item.name: Trench
item.comment: Essen 2013, great artwork and game!

item.name: Twilight Struggle
item.comment: Amazing experience! one of the best boardgames i have ever played! I didnt like the theme very much but it describes the last 60 years modern history that we all know much or less. An excellent hand management mechanism plus some possible minor dice rolls and a lot of strategic decisions to make. Perfect! I played some rules wrong during the game but the pleasure feeling is the same. A must play for every boardgamer out there.

item.name: U-Boat Leader
item.comment: finally i bought it, it is trully a great game...
item.conditiontext: All errata and the official updates have been corrected by pen to the rulebook. Components are in zip lock bags, many BGG files and sheets have been printed for this awesome game. The few plays i had were with sleeved cards but i ll keep the sleeves because i need them for other card games.

item.name: UNO
item.comment:
καρτοπαιχνιδο για να παιζεις με τα παιδακια σου.
A simple card game to play with your kids.

item.name: Up Front
item.comment:
One of my favorite games with my best friend at high school.
Επικες παρτιδες με τον 'αδελφο' μου Ιωαννη, εκπληκτικες αναμνησεις απο τα λυκειακα χρονια (1989-1991).

item.name: WarCraft: The Board Game
item.comment: The PC game's mechanisms are well implented in this one. A very good introduction game for the young players.

item.name: Warfighter: The Tactical Special Forces Card Game
item.comment: I like it, easy to learn, it plays fast (if you choose objective locations at #4 - #6 place), its simpler that the other DVG awesome solo games and it has some tough tactical decisions. Cover fire!
item.conditiontext: 2nd edition + Expansions 1-3 Additional soldier minis

item.name: Warhammer 40,000: Conquest
item.comment: i think that i must choose this or SW:LCG to save some money..ok, I just played it for the first time, indeed, this is the evolution in the genre...

item.name: Warrior Knights
item.comment: Seen that at the Essen Spiel 11 sold for 20 euros (english edition). 1st play, solo with 4 barons, the session took me around 6 hours but overall the gaming experience was great! I love the game's mechanisms, it's a great game and propably one of my favorites, time will tell.

item.name: Warrior Knights: Crown and Glory
item.comment: an excellent expansion, if you liked warrior knights you should definately buy this one.

item.name: Where There Is Discord: War in the South Atlantic
item.comment: well, i ve managed to watch the epic ~8 hour video walkthrough of callasmar and i got a very good picture of the game. The verdict is that i ll pass since its flaws are greater than the enjoyment of the gameplay. The game as a whole is interesting but needs a serious redesign and at the counters too!. Until then, as i said, i ll just pass.

item.name: Wings of War: Deluxe Set
item.comment:
Αερομαχίες στο τραπέζι ή και στο χαλί.
EDIT: trade it for Warrior Knights in the 5th Greek math trade.

item.name: Απολύομαι!
item.comment: Roll and move mechanism

item.name: Η απαγορευμένη νήσος
item.comment: A very good family game. // sleeved

item.name: Κυκλάδες
item.comment: Excellent hybrid boardgame. The mix of Euro and ameritrash mechanisms are well combined in this one. The theme of course is intriguing, but the miniatures are AWESOME! One of the best boardgames out there for everyone, boardgamer or not!

item.name: Μεσόγειος
item.comment: An excellent quick/strategy/area control boardgame. Love it!
item.conditiontext: 1 purple round token is missing 19/20, box has pressured/white corners

item.name: Μια φορά κι έναν καιρό
item.originalname: Once Upon a Time: The Storytelling Card Game

item.name: Ο Άρχοντας των Δαχτυλιδιών
item.comment: Aquired May 2011

item.name: Ο ελαφρόμυαλος Φαραώ
item.comment:
Ωραιο παιχνιδι για να το παίζεις με τα παιδια σου. Ειναι μια παραλλαγη του Memory, οτι πρεπει για τους μικρους μας φιλους.
A nice game to play with your kids.

item.name: Οι Εξερευνητές: Η Πυραμίδα του Χόρους
item.originalname: The Adventurers: The Pyramid of Horus
item.comment: i just played that with my 10 and 7 year old kids and they totally love it as i did. For me this is definately a marvellous family game.

item.name: Οι Κουρσάροι
item.comment: nice bluffing card game with cool miniatures!

item.name: Πανδημία
item.comment:
If you like ''Defenders of the realm'' but you dont have the time and space to play it, then this is the best alternative.
-----------------

item.name: Περιπέτειες στο Δάσος
item.comment: a quick, fun, family and kids game

item.name: Περσικοί Πόλεμοι
item.comment: A pleasant dice fest, area control, tactical, aggresive game with 4 scenarios that each one uses a different map area. Its much better to play this with your kids and friends than risk!

item.name: ΡΟΒΙΝΣΩΝΑΣ
item.comment: a great solitaire card game

item.name: Σαμποτέρ
item.comment: slightly boring after a couple of plays. Kids love it though

item.name: Στα Κάστρα του Μυστρά
item.comment: I love it!

item.name: Σταυροφορία στο Διάστημα
item.comment: Eπικες μαχες αναμεσα σε μενα, τον Λευτερη και τον Ανέστη. Ουτε που θυμαμαι ποσες ωρες ειχαμε περασει στη δικια μας ζεστη γιάφκα. Χαρη σε αυτο ειχαμε περασει ενα απο τα ωραιοτερα καλοκαίρια. Trade the 2nd english copy with Cyclades
item.conditiontext:
English edition, bought it for the included expansion and now have two copies. Some boxe's corners are ripped due to age
missing
1 red order close assault (there is a similar blue order, may photocopy that) 1 golden door + base 1 green reinforcement Orc blip These missing componets doesnt affect gameplay Also some plastic figures are painted.

item.name: Σωκράτης
item.comment: i believe its a collectable boardgame for the future Greek generations

item.name: Τελική αναμέτρηση: Ήρωες και Δράκοντες
item.comment: great miniatures, horrible game
item.conditiontext: All components are present, rulebook has some pen remarks, few weapons are broken but kept in zip lock bags, some miniatures are painted, an inner and outer box corners are ripped, 2 of the 8 castles pins are broken but this isnt an issue for the game play. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Το βιβλιο κανονων εχει καποιες υπογραμμισεις με στυλο και μερικα οπλα απο τις μινιατουρες ειναι σπασμενα και φυλαγμενα σε σακουλακι, απο το συναρμολογουμενο καστρο καποιες ακιδες (2/8) εχουν σπασει αλλα στηνεται κανονικα παρολα αυτα, απο το κουτι μια εσωτερικη και μια εξωτερικη γωνια ειναι σχισμενες και κολλημενες με σελοτεηπ, ολα τα λοιπα περιεχομενα ειναι κομπλε και αρκετες μινιατουρες ειναι βαμμενες.

item.name: Τολέδο
item.comment: Α pleasant family-party game, easy rules to hold on and very fun feeling during plays. Light strategy and very little complex. I enjoy it!
